column4: Hey folks, on my way to completely linux...with one last issue. My Ubuntu Intrepid desktop. I added a HDD that formerly has M$ XP on it and I'm trying to get Ubuntu to see it and automount it so can use it for storage.
Any pointers to a site with steps?
in my experience it should usually appear automatically. If it doesn't its possible that it has a NTFS partition which was not cleanly unmounted.
that is what happened...
when that happens I usually mount it from the command line using --force
(I'm not sure if its completely safe, but so far it worked fine)
hmm... sudo mount sda1 --force
I think it would be something like mount --force /dev/sdaX /media/EmptyDirectory
sudo mount ... :) sorry
I have no idea what is still on there...
I formatted using ext3
I see /dev/sda1 =  ext3
you formatted the new disk? so its not NTFS anymore? hm
Old disk, was NTFS with boot part on it, for sure.
erm, /dev/sda1 would probably be the old disk.
can I parted it to make it 100% clean?
well, you can use gparted to see in what state it is right now
kk, it is working on it now. (gparted is)
Be careful though... :)
btw, how many disks did gparted find?
/dev/sda1 114.48 GiB + 7.84 MiB unallocated
